intro: Zygogynum tieghemii subsp. synchronanthum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. It produces small, dark-colored fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
